text: Hi friends. Our org just made the call to go with HS CMS and I'm the one charged with figuring it out. In terms of tooling, is there any way to develop a theme locally with my own editor or am I stuck with the online editor?
Yes you can develop locally, it requires using ftp
there is also a new local server functionality that’s in testing, ask around and someone will have the link to it
I'll jump into the course then I'm sure I'll be back with questions.
Does anybody know what CMS runs on behind the scenes? Like is it Liquid/Handlebars/etc or is it a proprietary thing?
HubSpot is it’s own CMS, and it uses HubL which is HubSpot’s flavor of Jinja
it’s similar to liquid if you’ve used that

Also be aware, while you can do things locally and through FTP, you will still need to use the design manager in the actual back end some times.

They are actively working to make it so you can do more locally, and if after trying it you have some thoughts on it, voicing those thoughts in this slack is a great idea, the devs are actively listening to that
